snippet: Apocalypse now, or soon, or something.
abstract: Apocalypse now, or soon, or something.
lead_paragraph: As part of a longer-term project, I've been looking into the why and how of the dominance of austerity rhetoric over most of the past two years. One aspect is the rapturous glee with which policymakers seized on the theory of expansionary austerity, without waiting to see how well it would stand up under scrutiny (and the answer was, not well at all).
